test-case.name: when a commit header has a name that contains a period, it should correctly deserialize headers
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the stream identifier
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the stream stream revision
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the commit identifier
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the commit sequence
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the commit stamp
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the headers
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should correctly persist the events
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should add the commit to the set of undispatched commits
when a commit is successfully persisted, it should cause the stream to be found in the list of streams to snapshot
when reading from a given revision, it should start from the commit which contains the min stream revision specified
when reading from a given revision, it should read up to the commit which contains the max stream revision specified
when reading from a given revision to commit revision, it should start from the commit which contains the min stream revision specified
when reading from a given revision to commit revision, it should read up to the commit which contains the max stream revision specified
when committing a stream with the same revision, it should throw a ConcurrencyException
when committing a stream with the same sequence, it should throw a ConcurrencyException
when attempting to overwrite a committed sequence, it should throw a ConcurrencyException
when attempting to persist a commit twice, it should throw a DuplicateCommitException
when a commit has been marked as dispatched, it should no longer be found in the set of undispatched commits
when committing more events than the configured page size, it should load the same number of commits which have been persisted
when committing more events than the configured page size, it should load the same commits which have been persisted
when saving a snapshot, it should indicate the snapshot was added
when saving a snapshot, it should be able to retrieve the snapshot
when retrieving a snapshot, it should load the most recent prior snapshot
when retrieving a snapshot, it should have the correct snapshot payload
when retrieving a snapshot, it should have the correct stream id
when a snapshot has been added to the most recent commit of a stream, it should no longer find the stream in the set of streams to be snapshot
when adding a commit after a snapshot, it should find the stream in the set of streams to be snapshot when within the threshold
when adding a commit after a snapshot, it should not find the stream in the set of streams to be snapshot when over the threshold
when reading all commits from a particular point in time, it should return all commits on or after the point in time specified
when paging over all commits from a particular point in time, it should load the same number of commits which have been persisted
when paging over all commits from a particular point in time, it should load the same commits which have been persisted
when paging over all commits from a particular checkpoint, it should load the same number of commits which have been persisted starting from the checkpoint
when paging over all commits from a particular checkpoint, it should load only the commits starting from the checkpoint
when paging over all commits of a bucket from a particular checkpoint, it should load the same number of commits which have been persisted starting from the checkpoint
when paging over all commits of a bucket from a particular checkpoint, it should load only the commits on bucket1 starting from the checkpoint
when paging over all commits of a bucket from a particular checkpoint, it should not load the commits from bucket2
when reading all commits from the year 1 AD, it should NOT throw an exception
when purging all commits, it should not find any commits stored
when purging all commits, it should not find any streams to snapshot
when purging all commits, it should not find any undispatched commits
when invoking after disposal, it should throw an ObjectDisposedException
when committing a stream with the same id as a stream same bucket, it should throw
when committing a stream with the same id as a stream same bucket, it should be duplicate commit exception
when committing a stream with the same id as a stream in another bucket, it should succeed
when committing a stream with the same id as a stream in another bucket, it should persist to the correct bucket
when committing a stream with the same id as a stream in another bucket, it should not affect the stream from the other bucket
when saving a snapshot for a stream with the same id as a stream in another bucket, it should affect snapshots from another bucket
when reading all commits from a particular point in time and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should not return commits from other buckets
when getting all commits since checkpoint and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should not be empty
when getting all commits since checkpoint and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should be in order by checkpoint
when purging all commits and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should purge all commits stored in bucket a
when purging all commits and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should purge all commits stored in bucket b
when purging all commits and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should purge all streams to snapshot in bucket a
when purging all commits and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should purge all streams to snapshot in bucket b
when purging all commits and there are streams in multiple buckets, it should purge all undispatched commits
when gettingfromcheckpoint amount of commits exceeds pagesize, it Should have expected number of commits
when a payload is large, it can commit
